intro: Oenanthe linearis subsp. sinensis, commonly known as Chinese water dropwort, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, hollow stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as stream banks and forest floors. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a distinctive, slightly hairy texture. The species is native to eastern Asia, including China, Japan, and Korea.
